newsitem.title: MEXICO: Wings eyeing new restaurant chain.
newsitem.headline: Wings eyeing new restaurant chain.

text.p: Mexican restaurant group Corporacion Mexicana de Restaurantes (Wings) may use the proceeds from its recent initial public offering to buy another chain, the Finamex brokerage said on Thursday.
"According to company officials, Wings may be opting to buy out another chain of similar, restaurants, possibly Toks of (retailer) Grupo Gigante," wrote analyst Gerardo Copca in a research report.
"Company officials told us recently, however, that the asking price may be too high," Copca added.
Wings went public on June 2 by placing 27.15 percent of its equity on the Mexican bourse, from which it raised $21.8 million.
((--Tomas de la Rosa, Mexico City newsroom +525 728-7912))
